intro: Onobroma carlinoides, commonly known as the Carlin's globe flower, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, globe-shaped inflorescence composed of numerous small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Onobroma carlinoides is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
